notes: Sorted by date_ah ascending (original 16 entries); later entries appended in discovery order. Undated manuscripts placed at end. Confidence levels: confirmed = colophon visually verified by this project; attributed = signed colophon documented in a primary published source; catalogued = listed in a scholarly catalog without our independent verification; unverified = secondary mention only. YEK portal exhaustively searched (4 sessions, 2026-02-25/26). FIHRIST searches completed 2026-02-26. PDF gap analysis completed 2026-02-26. Online catalog sweep completed 2026-02-26. Pre-report enrichment sweep 2026-02-27. khandan_manuscripts.md research integration 2026-02-27: 3 new entries (michigan_qita_914, berlin_khayyam_leaf, majlis_nasimi_910); enriched private_paris_yusuf_923 (Sotheby's Paris 2015), stpetersburg_navai_935 (RNL confirmed), hazine_evkaf_qita (H.2154 correction), roseberys_2020_layla_921 (lot numbering).

manuscript.date_notes: Dated by colophon

attribution.source_citation: Bayani, Mahdī. Aḥwāl va Āsār-i Khwushnivīsān. Vol. I. Tehran, 1345 sh [1966], pp. 268–271; also cited in baysunghur.org/?p=1821

entries.further_action: Access to Iranian private collections requires direct institutional contact. Consider FNKhA / Dirāyatī catalog search.
entries.notes: Earliest known dated Khandan manuscript. Location current as of Bayani (1966); may have changed hands.

manuscript.date_notes: Dated by colophon

attribution.source_citation: Bayani, Mahdī. Aḥwāl va Āsār-i Khwushnivīsān. Vol. I. Tehran, 1345 sh [1966], pp. 268–271

entries.further_action: Bayani collection location after 1966 unknown. May now be in an Iranian public collection.
entries.notes: Signature formula reported in Bayani as 'written by Sultan Muhammad Khandan'.

manuscript.date_notes: Reported in secondary source; NOT confirmed by FIHRIST search

attribution.source_citation: baysunghur.org/?p=1821, citing Bayani
attribution.our_verification: FIHRIST searched 2026-02-26: no BL Hafiz divan attributed to Khandan at any date found. The only BL manuscript by Khandan dated 921 AH is Add. 7753 (Qiran al-Sadayn). A Hafiz divan by Khandan is at Rylands Library (Manchester), dated 937 AH (Persian MS 842). This entry is likely a bibliographic error.

entries.further_action: Source (Bayani via baysunghur.org) likely misidentified institution or date. Probable correct record: Rylands Persian MS 842 (Hafiz, 937 AH). Consider merging or deleting this entry.
entries.notes: RESOLVED 2026-02-27: No evidence of a BL Hafiz by Khandan dated 921 AH found in FIHRIST, BL catalog searches, or web searches. baysunghur.org (Saadati 2021) traces this to Bayani, who places it at "the British Museum, London." The confirmed Hafiz by Khandan is Rylands Persian MS 842 (937 AH, Herat). This entry is most likely a bibliographic error — either a confusion of institution (Rylands ≠ BL) or date (937 ≠ 921). Retained in corpus with bibliographic_error status for traceability.

manuscript.date_notes: Dated by colophon; same year as bl_hafiz_921 — possibly copied as a pair

attribution.source_citation: BL Add. 7753; documented in BL blog; baysunghur.org/?p=1821, citing Bayani
attribution.our_verification: Shelfmark Add. 7753 confirmed via BL sources and secondary literature, 2026-02-26. Not yet in FIHRIST.

entries.notes: Shelfmark confirmed: BL Add. 7753. Copied at Herat, 921 AH / 1515 CE. Same year as the sothebys_2018_lot58 Layla wa Majnun — possibly part of the same commission or copying programme. Not yet catalogued in FIHRIST as of 2026-02-26.

manuscript.date_notes: Dated by colophon in gold nastaʿlīq within cloud formations

attribution.source_citation: Sotheby's London, Arts of the Islamic World, 19 April 2018, lot 58
attribution.our_verification: Auction catalog lot text and description retrieved 2026-02-26

entries.further_action: If buyer is a Turkish institution, check YEK or yazmalar.gov.tr. Buyer identity unknown.
entries.notes: 125 ff. + 4 fly-leaves; 15 lines/page in 2 columns; gold-stamped leather binding. Comparanda cited in lot: Harvard Art Museums inv. 1985.263; Topkapi H.2356; Sotheby's Paris 22 Oct 2015 lot 9; Bonhams London 13 Oct 2005 lot 27; Christie's London 7 Oct 2008 lot 305; Christie's London 13 Apr 2010 lot 174.

manuscript.date_notes: Colophon dated beginning of Rabīʿ I AH 921 / April 1515 AD. Note: Roseberys lot title misprints '1505' — body text gives correct date 1515.

attribution.source_citation: Roseberys London, Islamic & Indian Art, 23 Oct 2020, lot 13. Price realised: £4,680 (est. £2,000–3,000).
attribution.colophon_text: Colophon giving the name Sultan Muhammad Khandan and the date beginning of Rabīʿ I AH 921

entries.notes: Second copy of Jami Layla wa Majnun by Khandan with same date (AH 921) as Sotheby's 2018 lot 58 — two distinct manuscripts. Roseberys 2021 lot 101 catalogue note cross-references: 'Another manuscript copied by Sultan Muhammad Khandan and dated to the same period was sold in these rooms, 23 October 2020, lot 13.' 15ll. black nastaliq in 2 columns; flowers between columns; opening bifolio with cloudbands on red ground; owner's seal impressions; brown morocco binding. Note: lot numbering discrepancy — Roseberys' own 2021 catalogue (lot 101) cross-references this as 'lot 13', but some auction records show lot 18 (pre-sale) and lot 91 (post-sale results). May reflect session renumbering.

manuscript.date_notes: Dated by colophon

attribution.source_citation: Sotheby's Paris, 22 October 2015, lot 9, sale PF1519 'Regards sur l'Orient', est. €10,000–15,000. Also cited in baysunghur.org/?p=1821 (Bayani). Catalog references: Roxburgh 2001 p. 62; Bayani 1988 vol. I pp. 268–271; Karatay 1961 cat. 777, 787.

entries.further_action: Sold at auction 2015; current location unknown. May reappear at auction.
entries.notes: Sotheby's Paris 2015 lot 9 provides significant details: 11 folios, 8 lines nastaʿlīq per page, two miniatures (Zulaikha preventing Yusuf from leaving; the two protagonists embraced), ink/gouache/gold on paper with polychrome margins and golden garland decoration. Brown-black morocco binding with gold-stamped decoration. 25 × 16 cm. Signed colophon.

manuscript.date_notes: Dated by colophon; 'early spring 926 AH'

attribution.source_citation: baysunghur.org/?p=1821, citing Bayani

entries.further_action: Afghan national archives — inaccessible. Survival uncertain given decades of conflict.
entries.notes: Status of the Kabul National Archive collection is uncertain due to political instability.

manuscript.date_notes: Dated and signed by Khandan in colophon

attribution.source_citation: Christie's London, Islamic Manuscripts, lot 5125432.
attribution.colophon_text: مشقه العبد سلطان محمد خندان فی سنه الثلاثین و تسعمائه الهجریه
attribution.our_verification: Christie's lot description retrieved 2026-02-26

entries.further_action: Christie's catalog cites Karatay 1961 nos. 777 and 787 as Topkapi comparanda — check yazmalar.gov.tr for those records. Buyer unknown.
entries.notes: 224 ff. + 4 fly-leaves; 14 lines/page; two columns; gold intercolumnar rules; ivory paper. Place of copying Herat stated. Karatay 1961 nos. 777 and 787 cited as comparable Topkapi copies. NOTE: baysunghur.org (Saadati 2021) separately lists a Subhat al-Abrar 930 AH in the collection of Jafar Sultani al-Qurani, Tehran, with same raqm. This may be the same manuscript before auction, or a distinct copy. UPDATED 2026-02-27: Searched for a separate "Sultani al-Qurani" copy of Subhat al-Abrar 930 AH. No evidence of a distinct manuscript found. baysunghur.org's mention of two 930 AH copies likely refers to this Christie's lot under a different provenance label. Treated as one manuscript unless contradicted by Bayani 1966 directly.

text.title: Anthology (Rumi, Niẓāmī, Saʿdī, Sanāʾī)
text.author: Selections from Rumi (Masnavi), Nizami (Khamsa), Saʿdi (Bustan), Sanaʾi (Hadiqa)

manuscript.date_notes: Colophon on f. 28r: 'written by poor slave Ali al-Husayni ... in year 930 in the city of Herat'; another colophon on f. 54r signed by Muhammad Qasim b. Shadishah

holding.institution: Freer Gallery of Art, Smithsonian Institution

attribution.source_citation: Freer Gallery of Art accession F1944.48; Smithsonian online record
attribution.colophon_text: Folio inscription f. 3r: 'selection from Sanaʾi's Hadiqa written by Sultan Muhammad Khandan'
attribution.our_verification: Smithsonian online record retrieved 2026-02-26. Accession number F1944.48 confirmed (distinct from F1937.22 which is the calligraphy panel). Khandan copied ONLY the Sanaʾi section (Hadiqat al-haqiqat). Other sections: Rumi by Mir ʿAli Husayni; Nizami by Sultan Muhammad Nur; Saʿdi by Muhammad Qasim b. Shadishah. Painting by Bihzad.

entries.notes: COLLABORATIVE MANUSCRIPT. Khandan copied only the Sanaʾi (Hadiqat al-haqiqat) section — NOT the full anthology. 69 folios + 1 flyleaf. 4 columns, 21 lines/page. 1 shamsa, 4 sarlawh, 6 gold stenciled folios, 1 Bihzad painting. Purchased Freer 1944. Same year (930 AH) as christies_subhat_930.

manuscript.date_notes: Dated by colophon

attribution.source_citation: baysunghur.org/?p=1821, citing Bayani. Confirmed via abadis.ir: 'یک نسخه دیوان ترکی امیرعلی شیر نوایی (۹۳۵ق) به قلم کتابت، که در کتابخانۀ عمومی لنینگراد (سن پترزبورگ) محفوظ است.' RNL uses Dorn catalog numbering system (after B.A. Dorn's 1852 catalog); specific Dorn number unknown.

entries.further_action: Identify Dorn catalog number. RNL published 'Works of Alishir Navai in fine books of the 15th–16th centuries' — likely discusses this ms.
entries.notes: Navaʾī was Khandan's early patron; one of four Chagatay Turkish manuscripts in the corpus (with tiem_01942, bodleian_suhili, tehran_nmi_navai). Confirmed at Russian National Library (formerly Imperial Public Library / Leningrad Public Library), not IOM RAS.

manuscript.date_notes: Dated by colophon

attribution.source_citation: Bonhams London, 13 October 2005, lot 27. Full catalog entry retrieved 2026-02-26.
attribution.colophon_text: Signed in verse on folio 160b by Sultan Muhammad Khandan.
attribution.our_verification: Bonhams lot record scraped 2026-02-26. 162 leaves, 14 lines, 278x189 mm. 5 miniatures in Bukhara style. Provenance traces through Safavid and Mughal royal libraries.

entries.notes: Sold for GBP 45,600 inc. premium. PROVENANCE: (1) library inscription f.2a names Sultan Muhammad Khandan as scribe; (2) Shah Abbas I Safavid royal library (r. 995-1038/1587-1629); (3) Mughal royal library, probably Shah Jahan (r. 1037-1068/1628-57); (4) Shah Alam II inspected in 17th regnal year (1190/1770). Bayani dates Khandan activity 915-957 AH, making this one of his last works. One double-page + four full-page miniatures in Bukhara style. A second Bustan in the corpus alongside bayani_bustan_920 and chester_beatty_bustan_916.

manuscript.date_notes: Dated by colophon

attribution.source_citation: Gulbenkian Museum online catalog (accessed 2026-02-26); also cited in secondary literature and Marianna Shreve Simpson Islamic Manuscript Record Archive (Work Record ID 569804)
attribution.our_verification: Shelfmark LA159 CONFIRMED via Gulbenkian Museum online catalog, 2026-02-26. Calligrapher explicitly listed as 'Sultan Muhammad Khandan'. Painter: Abdullah al-Shirazi. Origin: Mashhad. NOTE: website date '1482-1483' is composition date of the poem, NOT copying date (972 AH / 1564 CE from secondary literature).

entries.notes: LATEST KNOWN DATED KHANDAN COPY - 972 AH / 1564 CE. Shelfmark LA159 confirmed. Origin: Mashhad. Illuminated by Abdullah al-Shirazi (full name from Gulbenkian catalog). Extends confirmed Khandan activity to within 20 years of Bayani's outer limit of 992 AH. Neighboring shelfmark: Baharistan = LA 169.

text.title: Album leaf: Fettered Camel and Keeper (recto); Calligraphy panel (verso)
text.author: Bihzad (painting, recto); Sultan Muhammad Khandan (calligraphy, verso); Baba al-Mudhahhib (gilding)
text.author_arabic: بهزاد (رسم)؛ سلطان محمد خندان (خط)؛ بابا المذهب (تذهیب)

manuscript.date_notes: Freer record gives 'Late 15th century' — inconsistent with Khandan's confirmed activity from 915 AH/1509; likely an approximate dating. Adjusted to c. 1510–1550.

holding.institution: Freer Gallery of Art, Smithsonian Institution

attribution.source_citation: Smithsonian / National Museum of Asian Art object record F1937.22
attribution.signature_formula: العبد سلطان محمد خندان، حرره بابا المذهب
attribution.our_verification: Freer Gallery online record scraped 2026-02-26. Title corrected from 'blessing formula' to 'Fettered Camel and Keeper'. Gilder confirmed as Baba al-Mudhahhib, NOT Hashim Mudhahhib (that is LACMA 1982.120.4).

entries.notes: Double-sided album leaf: recto = painting attributed to Bihzad (fettered camel and keeper); verso = calligraphy panel by Khandan. Gilding by Baba al-Mudhahhib. Inscription: 'The slave Sultan-Muhammad Khandan, outlined by Baba the Gilder'. Provenance: Armenag Bey Sakisian → H. Kevorkian → Freer Gallery 1937.

manuscript.date_notes: Cleveland Museum dates c. 1509–59 CE

attribution.source_citation: Cleveland Museum of Art accession record 1983.1115.a; gift of Mrs. Mehmed A. Simsar (1983)
attribution.our_verification: CMA record retrieved 2026-02-26

entries.notes: Sheet: 27.4 × 20 cm; text area: 18.7 × 10.9 cm. Signature in triangle at lower left of inner text block. Contains diagonal quatrain addressing a ruler, horizontal panel praising the beloved, and calligraphic alphabet exercises on right side. CC0 license.

manuscript.date_notes: Date unknown; album likely compiled over time

attribution.source_citation: Sotheby's London, Arts of the Islamic World, 19 April 2018, lot 58 — cited as comparandum

entries.further_action: yazmalar.gov.tr = YEK portal — already exhaustively searched (Sessions 1–3, 2026-02-25/26). No Topkapi Khandan attributions found in YEK. To confirm H.2356 Khandan pages: contact Topkapi Palace Museum Library directly, or consult Karatay 1961 printed catalogue in a research library.
entries.notes: Cited in Sotheby's 2018 lot 58 lot note as containing pages in Khandan's hand. Topkapi H-series = Hazine collection. yazmalar.gov.tr = same system as YEK portal (confirmed 2026-02-26). Sessions 1–3 found zero Topkapi Khandan records in YEK person-attribution fields.

manuscript.date_notes: Dated by colophon: 'completed by Muhammad Khandan in AH 920 (1514/15)'
manuscript.patron: ʿAlī Shīr Navāʾī (noted in shamsah f.1r; died 1501, before ms completion)
manuscript.support: Original brown paper remounted on white paper (perhaps 18th century)

attribution.source_citation: FIHRIST record manuscript_32714; British Library India Office Library
attribution.colophon_text: Completed by Muhammad Khandan in AH 920 (1514/15)
attribution.our_verification: FIHRIST record confirmed 2026-02-26. 380 folios + 2 preliminary. 15 lines/page. Illumination: 8-pointed shamsa f.1r; cloud-band illumination ff.1v-2r. Purchased by Government of India 1859; transferred India Office Library 1876.

entries.notes: NEW FIND (FIHRIST 2026-02-26). Earliest confirmed Khandan manuscript in a public institution. Colophon names 'Muhammad Khandan' (without Sultan title — shorter form). Prose text: 'Memorial of Saints' by Attar. Not previously in the corpus.

manuscript.date_notes: ANOMALOUS — 888 AH predates Khandan's confirmed activity by ~27 years. Date may be of text composition, not manuscript copying, or may be a cataloguing error.

attribution.source_citation: FIHRIST record manuscript_6431; Meredith-Owens, Handlist of Persian Manuscripts 1895–1966, London 1968, p. 56
attribution.our_verification: FIHRIST record confirmed 2026-02-26. Includes miniatures. Colophon not transcribed in FIHRIST.

entries.further_action: Verify date: 888 AH predates Khandan by ~27 years. Physical examination or correspondence with BL needed to determine if date refers to text composition or manuscript copying.
entries.notes: UPDATED 2026-02-27: Simpson (Sultan Ibrahim Mirza's Haft Awrang) confirms "Shahi dated 888/1483-84 (BL Or. 8760)". Meredith-Owens 1968 p.56 is the BL catalog source. The 888 AH date appears to be the copying date per standard catalog convention. This predates Khandan's confirmed activity (915 AH) by 27 years. Either: (a) the attribution to Khandan is incorrect and this is by a different scribe; (b) Khandan's activity began earlier than currently documented; or (c) 888 AH is a text composition date misread as a copying date. Without access to the manuscript, this cannot be resolved. Status remains unverified.

text.title: Specimens of calligraphy by various calligraphers
text.author: Multiple (Sultan Muhammad Nur, ʿAlī Riḍā, Sultan Muhammad Khandan)

manuscript.date_notes: Individual specimens dated AH 925, 942, 962, and 977

attribution.source_citation: FIHRIST record manuscript_5387; bequeathed by P.C. Manuk and Miss G.M. Coles through National Art Collections Fund, October 1948; transferred to BL 1973
attribution.our_verification: FIHRIST record confirmed 2026-02-26. Khandan named among calligraphers represented; other calligraphers: Sultan Muhammad Nur, ʿAli Riza. Specimens dated 925, 942, 962, 977 AH.

entries.notes: NEW FIND (FIHRIST 2026-02-26). Album containing calligraphy specimens by multiple Herat-tradition scribes. Khandan shares the album with Sultan Muhammad Nur — both are named in the FIHRIST record. Specimen dates span 925–977 AH, consistent with Khandan's activity.

manuscript.date_notes: Colophon: 'Completed by Sultan Muhammad Khandan in Herat in 937 AH'

holding.institution: John Rylands Library, University of Manchester

attribution.source_citation: FIHRIST record manuscript_7351; John Rylands Library
attribution.colophon_text: Completed by Sultan Muhammad Khandan in Herat in 937 AH
attribution.our_verification: FIHRIST record confirmed 2026-02-26. Colophon names calligrapher and gives Herat as place of copying.

entries.notes: NEW FIND (FIHRIST 2026-02-26). The 'BL Hafiz 921 AH' referenced in secondary sources (baysunghur.org citing Bayani) is likely a misidentification of this manuscript or a bibliographic error — the Hafiz divan by Khandan is at Rylands (Manchester), dated 937 AH / 1530 CE (NOT BL, NOT 921 AH). Colophon names place: Herat. Full colophon text: 'Completed by Sultan Muhammad Khandan in Herat in 937 AH'.

manuscript.date_notes: Undated

attribution.source_citation: FIHRIST record manuscript_23004; Elliott Collection; Ethe cat. no. 981
attribution.our_verification: Shelfmark confirmed via FIHRIST 2026-02-26. 98 folios. Author: Suhayli, Nizam al-Din Ahmad (Chagatay-tradition Persian poet). Provenance: John Bardoe Elliott collection, presented to Bodleian 1859.

entries.notes: Shelfmark confirmed: Bodleian MS. Elliott 102. 98 folios. Undated. Chagatay-tradition Persian divan — one of two Chagatay-language manuscripts in the corpus. FIHRIST URL: https://www.fihrist.org.uk/catalog/manuscript_23004

text.title: Munājātnāma
text.author: Attributed to Imam ʿAlī ibn Abī Ṭālib

manuscript.date_notes: Undated

holding.institution: Kitābkhāna-yi Mālik (Malik National Library and Museum)

attribution.source_citation: baysunghur.org/?p=1821: 'published 1391 SH / 2012 CE'

entries.further_action: A published edition exists (1391 SH / 2012). The publication itself may contain the colophon transcription. Malik Museum catalog may be searchable.
entries.notes: A published facsimile or edition was issued in 2012 — this may contain a transcription of Khandan's colophon.

text.title: Album folio: Verses from Niẓāmī's Khusraw va Shīrīn (recto); Dragon in Foliage drawing (verso)
text.author: Niẓāmī Ganjavī (text); Sultan Muhammad Khandan (calligrapher)

manuscript.date_ce: c. 1509–1550 (museum dates as '15th century / Turkman period' — inconsistent with Khandan's activity from 915 AH)
manuscript.date_notes: Museum catalogues as '15th century, Turkman period' but Khandan active 915–992 AH (1509–1584 CE). Date requires reassessment.

holding.institution: Harvard Art Museums / Arthur M. Sackler Museum (Edwin Binney, 3rd Collection of Turkish Art)

attribution.source_citation: Harvard Art Museums accession 1985.263 (object ID 201588); bequeathed by Edwin Binney, 3rd, 1985
attribution.our_verification: Harvard Art Museums online record retrieved 2026-02-26. Object confirmed as single album folio (NOT a manuscript codex). Calligrapher Sultan Muhammad Khandan explicitly named in museum record. NOTE: URL https://www.harvardartmuseums.org/art/352087 leads to a different object (HAM 12.2015, a Haft Awrang manuscript, unrelated to Khandan).

entries.notes: This is a single album leaf (qitʿa), not a bound manuscript. Medium: ink, opaque watercolor and gold on paper. Provenance: Dikran Khan Kelekian (by 1933) → Heeramaneck sale Oct 1962 → Edwin Binney, 3rd → Harvard Art Museums 1985. The museum's 'Turkman period' attribution for the date needs scholarly reassessment given Khandan's documented activity starts 915 AH / 1509 CE.

text.title: Ilāhīnāma
text.author: Khwāja ʿAbdullāh al-Anṣārī al-Harawī
text.author_arabic: أبو إسماعيل عبد الله بن محمد بن علي الهروي الأنصاري

manuscript.date_notes: Undated; no date in colophon

attribution.source_citation: YEK portal record 706550; colophon verified by colophon-verifier agent, 2026-02-25
attribution.colophon_text: قد وقع توفيق تنميق هذه الرسالة التي كانت الفاظها كبيره ومعانيها كثيره والمسمى بالهى نامه على يد اضعف عباد الله الصمد المنان سلطان محمد الخندان غفر ذنوبه وستر عيوبه
attribution.signature_formula: على يد اضعف عباد الله الصمد المنان سلطان محمد الخندان
attribution.our_verification: Colophon clearly legible on folio 10a (digitized page 11) at IIIF 1600px. Name form: سلطان محمد الخندان (with definite article). Confidence 0.95.

entries.notes: THE ONLY COLOPHON-CONFIRMED KHANDAN MANUSCRIPT IN THIS CORPUS. Found via سلطان محمد خندان in Nüshayla ilgili kişiler, Session 1, 2026-02-25. Colophon also transcribed in YEK İstinsah kaydı (Arap harfli) field. Catalogued by Zeynep Özçelik. See catalog/arkeoloji_00153.json for full ManuscriptRecord.

manuscript.date_notes: Undated; no date in YEK record

attribution.source_citation: YEK portal record 704748, Nüshayla ilgili kişiler field: 'Müstensih, Sultan Muhammed Handan'
attribution.our_verification: Colophon-verifier examined 64 pages (2026-02-25). No scribal colophon found. Attribution rests solely on cataloguer's entry.

entries.notes: YEK cataloguer listed Sultan Muhammed Handan as müstensih (copyist). Colophon-verifier examined all 64 digitized pages and found no scribal colophon. Attribution unconfirmed — rests entirely on cataloguer's identification, which may derive from Bayani or Karatay.

manuscript.date_notes: Undated; no date in YEK record

attribution.source_citation: YEK Session 4 title search, 2026-02-26. No copyist in Nüshayla ilgili kişiler.
attribution.colophon_text: على يد أضعف عبادالله و أحوجهم إلی فضل الله
attribution.signature_formula: أضعف عبادالله [name portion physically lost to folio damage]
attribution.our_verification: Three colophon-verifier sessions (2026-02-26). IIIF ID confirmed: 0000000664425. True total pages: 152. Colophon located on IIIF p147 left page (folio 144v), below the last red-bordered poetry column. Formula opening 'أضعف عباد[الله]' clearly legible at 5–12x magnification. Name portion physically lost: right margin of folio 144v is torn, and the scribe-name section of the colophon (which precedes the formula in RTL order) has been physically lost to folio damage. No higher-resolution approach can recover the missing text. Verdict: inconclusive. See catalog/yek_705856_verdict.json.

entries.further_action: Physical examination of the manuscript required to determine whether the missing colophon name portion was trimmed during rebinding (in which case it may survive as a separate fragment or in the binding) or was lost to damage. Direct contact with Istanbul Arkeoloji Muzesi is the recommended next step. No further digital verification is possible at the available resolution.
entries.notes: Three colophon-verifier sessions failed to resolve the scribe name due to physical folio damage, not resolution limitations. IIIF ID now confirmed: 0000000664425. Colophon page corrected to IIIF p147 left (folio 144v) — previous sessions misidentified viewer page 146 as the colophon page due to a viewer/IIIF page number offset of ~2. Formula 'أضعف عبادالله' is visible and matches Khandan's confirmed formula from arkeoloji_00153. Same institution as the only confirmed Khandan manuscript in this corpus. Bustan genre consistent with two other Bustan copies in the world corpus (bayani_bustan_920, bonhams_bustan_956). Contextual evidence is strong but insufficient for confirmation without the name.

text.title: Sayings of Imām ʿAlī
text.author: attr. Imām ʿAlī ibn Abī Ṭālib

manuscript.date_notes: Catalogued as 'Timurid Iran, 15th century' by Christie's. Falls before Khandan's documented range (AH 915–992); possibly early career or a cataloguing uncertainty.

attribution.source_citation: Christie's London, Islamic Art & Manuscripts, 13 Apr 2010, lot 174. Hammer price: £7,500. Christie's catalogue references Bayani vol. I pp. 268–71 and Karatay nos. 777, 787.
attribution.colophon_text: Colophon signed (verbatim text not recorded in catalogue)

entries.further_action: Verify '15th century' date — predates Khandan's documented activity (AH 915/1509). May indicate an earlier undocumented copy or a cataloguing uncertainty.
entries.notes: 17ff. + 2 fly-leaves. Each page: 3ll. large black tawqi' + 6ll. black nasta'liq in 2 columns within gold and black rules. Heavily illuminated Qajar headpiece. Qajar red and green morocco binding. Waterstaining; minor repairs. Text panel 19.6 × 11.3 cm.

manuscript.date_notes: Catalogued as 'Safavid Persia, 16th century' by Roseberys; PDF estimates probably 1530–60.

holding.institution: Sold at auction; buyer unknown (Important Private Collection)

attribution.source_citation: Roseberys London, Islamic & Indian Art, 26 Oct 2021, lot 101. Price realised: £36,400 (est. £2,000–3,000).
attribution.colophon_text: Colophon signed by Sultan Muhammad Khandan (verbatim text not recorded in catalogue)

entries.notes: 67 leaves + 6 fly-leaves. 14ll. black nastaliq in 2 columns; ruled black, red and blue. Outer margins: gold interlacing floral scrolls. f.1b: polychrome and gold heading. Brown stamped binding. Text panel 14.5 × 7 cm; leaf 24.8 × 16 cm. Exceptional hammer price (18× estimate). Roseberys 2020 lot 13 (Layla wa Majnun, AH 921) cross-referenced in this lot's catalogue note.

text.title: Horse and Groom, Folio (from an Album)
text.author: Painting attr. to ʿAbd al-Ṣamad; calligraphy by Khandān with gilding by Ḥāshim Muḍahhib

manuscript.date_notes: Painting: Iran, Tabriz, first half of 16th century. Album compiled for Bahram Mirza by calligrapher Dust Muhammad, 1544–45 CE.

holding.institution: Los Angeles County Museum of Art (LACMA)

attribution.source_citation: LACMA Unframed blog, 18 Nov 2025. Bequest of Edwin Binney, 3rd, Turkish Collection (acc. 1982.120.4). Also cited in ChatGPT PDF corpus.
attribution.signature_formula: Signed by Sultan Muhammad Khandan (on reverse calligraphy panel)

entries.further_action: Retrieve full LACMA object record for exact folio dimensions and full inscription text of the calligraphy panel.
entries.notes: Album folio. Recto: painting of horse and groom attr. to ʿAbd al-Ṣamad. Verso: two calligraphies, one in white nastaʿlīq signed by Sultan Muhammad Khandan, gilding by Ḥāshim Muḍahhib. Proposed to be from the Bahram Mirza album (1517–1549, brother of Shah Tahmasp) compiled by Dust Muhammad in 1544–45. Provenance: Bequest of Edwin Binney, 3rd. Cf. Freer F1937.22 for another Khandan calligraphy panel in the same Timurid-Safavid tradition (Baba al-Mudhahhib as gilder there, vs. Hāshim Muḍahhib here).

text.title: Calligraphic specimens
text.author: Sultan Muhammad Khandan; Shāh Maḥmūd al-Nīshāpūrī
text.author_arabic: سلطان محمد خندان؛ شاه محمود النيشابوري

manuscript.date_notes: No dates provided in archive record.

holding.institution: University of Michigan Library — Simpson Islamic Manuscript Record Archive

attribution.source_citation: Marianna Shreve Simpson Islamic Manuscript Record Archive, University of Michigan Library Digital Collections. Accessed 2026-02-26.

entries.further_action: Original manuscript identified as BL Or 11839 via Classification Filing Number. See bl_or_11839 in this corpus for full album details including FIHRIST record.
entries.notes: NOT a distinct physical manuscript. This is an archival photograph in Marianna Shreve Simpson's Islamic manuscript research archive (University of Michigan Library). The Classification Filing Number "Or 11839" identifies it as a record for BL Or 11839 (already in corpus as bl_or_11839). Retained for provenance traceability only.

manuscript.date_notes: Dated 15 Shaban 916 (17 November 1510), at Herat.

attribution.source_citation: Arberry, A.J. et al. The Chester Beatty Library: A Catalogue of the Persian Manuscripts and Miniatures, Vol. II (MSS 151-220). Dublin: Hodges Figgis, 1960, entry 183, pp. 44-45.
attribution.our_verification: Chester Beatty catalog PDF scraped 2026-02-26. 'Splendid calligraphic by a master hand'. Scribe signs himself Sultan Muhammad Khandan. Catalog cites death date 950 AH (Huart) - contradicted by Bayani (manuscripts to 957 AH).

entries.notes: Written surface 175x87 mm, 14 lines in two columns. Magnificent sarlauhs. Third Bustan in corpus (also bayani_bustan_920, bonhams_bustan_956). Second earliest dated Khandan ms after private_tehran_yusuf_915.

manuscript.date_notes: Dated 920 AH (1514), at Herat.

attribution.source_citation: Arberry, A.J. et al. The Chester Beatty Library: A Catalogue of the Persian Manuscripts and Miniatures, Vol. II (MSS 151-220). Dublin: Hodges Figgis, 1960, entry 184, p. 45.
attribution.our_verification: Chester Beatty catalog PDF scraped 2026-02-26. Same scribe as CBL Per 183.

entries.notes: Single folio. Recto: first 7 hemistichs of opening poem of Hafiz Divan. Verso: 4 rubai. Illumination of great delicacy. Same scribe as CBL Per 183.

manuscript.date_notes: Dated 925 AH per baysunghur.org (Saadati 2021).

attribution.source_citation: Saadati, Khodabakhsh. 'Sultan Muhammad Khandan'. baysunghur.org, 1400/01/22 [April 2021].

text.title: Calligraphic specimens (qita) in multiple muraqqa albums
text.author: Sultan Muhammad Khandan

manuscript.date_notes: Latest dated specimen: end of Jumada I 957 AH (1550 CE), in Muhammad Muhsin muraqqa. Other specimens undated.

holding.institution: Khazina-yi Awqaf / Hazine-i Evkaf (Topkapi Palace Library)

attribution.source_citation: Saadati, baysunghur.org/?p=1821 (2021), citing Bayani. Multiple albums.
attribution.colophon_text: تمت فی الاخر شهر جمیدی الاول سنه سبع و خمسین و تسعمائه کتبه سلطان محمد خندان
attribution.signature_formula: مشقه العبد سلطان محمد خندان / عبده سلطان محمد خندان / الفقیر سلطان محمد خندان / کتبه سلطان محمد خندان / سلطان محمد خندان غفر ذنوبه
attribution.our_verification: Listed in baysunghur.org article (scraped 2026-02-26). FOUR named albums: (1) Muraqqa of Amir Ghayb Bayg; (2) Muraqqa of Bahram Mirza; (3) Muraqqa of Sayyid Ahmad Mashhadi; (4) Muraqqa of Muhammad Muhsin (dated 957 AH). Plus additional unnamed albums.

entries.further_action: Bahram Mirza muraqqa is Topkapi H.2154 (confirmed via Encyclopaedia Iranica, Dust Muhammad article). H.2156 is a separate album. Contact Topkapi for individual qiṭʿa shelfmarks within the four named albums.
entries.notes: RICHEST SINGLE LOCATION for Khandan specimens. 4+ named albums. 957 AH dated specimen matches Bayani's activity range endpoint. Bahram Mirza album has specimens from do dang to ghubar, some on safidab.

manuscript.date_notes: Undated.

attribution.source_citation: Saadati, baysunghur.org/?p=1821 (2021), citing Bayani
attribution.our_verification: Listed in baysunghur.org article (scraped 2026-02-26). Single specimen.

entries.further_action: Contact Topkapi Palace Library for Revan Kosku album shelfmark.
entries.notes: Script: nim do dang jali. Revan Kiosk is separate from Hazine-i Evkaf within Topkapi.

manuscript.date_notes: Undated.

attribution.source_citation: Saadati, baysunghur.org/?p=1821 (2021), citing Bayani
attribution.our_verification: Listed in baysunghur.org article (scraped 2026-02-26). Single specimen.

entries.further_action: Search Edinburgh University Library Special Collections catalog.
entries.notes: Minimal detail in source.

manuscript.date_notes: Undated.

attribution.source_citation: Saadati, baysunghur.org/?p=1821 (2021), citing Bayani
attribution.our_verification: Listed in baysunghur.org article (scraped 2026-02-26). Same collection as bayani_bustan_920.

entries.further_action: Bayani collection location after 1966 unknown.
entries.notes: Script: do dang and kitabat-i jali. DISTINCT from bayani_bustan_920 (codex). Same collector: Mahdi Bayani.

manuscript.date_notes: Undated; attributed to 16th century on stylistic grounds

attribution.source_citation: Christie's London, The Oliver Hoare Collection, 25 Oct 2019, lot 79 (lot-6229991). Re-sold Mayfair Auction House, London, 25 May 2023, lot 31. Est. £3,000-5,000 (Christie's), £16,500-17,500 (Mayfair).

entries.notes: CRITICAL: Christie's describes the Khandan attribution as a 'pasted, purported signature' — the signature was physically glued onto the final folio, not written as part of the original colophon. Christie's estimated it at only £3,000-5,000 (vs. £45,600 for the confirmed Bonhams Bustan 956 AH), reflecting skepticism about the attribution. The 464-folio count is unusually large for a Bustan (typically ~130-180ff); may include supplementary texts or extensive commentary. Numerous Qajar illustrations are later additions. Oliver Hoare (1945-2018) was a noted London dealer in Islamic art. Wikimedia Commons has an image: File:Shaykh_Muslih_al-Din_Sa'di_(d._1292);_Bustan,_Safavid_Iran,_16th_century.jpg

manuscript.date_notes: 914 AH attributed to this specific specimen by baysunghur.org, but this is also the date of the earliest piece in a 42-specimen album (914–1317 AH) by multiple calligraphers. The 914 AH date may belong to this Khandan specimen or to another piece in the album. Requires verification.

holding.institution: University of Michigan, Special Collections Research Center

attribution.source_citation: Saadati, Khodabakhsh. baysunghur.org/?p=1821 (April 2021): 'A colophon in nastaʿlīq script by Sultan Muhammad Khandan; preserved in the University of Michigan Library … in the colophon of a manuscript dated 914 AH.' HathiTrust catalog record 006814657; cataloguing by Mamoun Sakkal; described in Muhittin Serin, 'Amerika Birleşik Devletleri'ndeki Bazı Kütüphanelerde Bulunan İslam El Yazma Eserleri ve Michigan Üniversitesi II. Abdülhamid Koleksiyonu.'
attribution.our_verification: Album fully digitized on HathiTrust (public domain). 48 page scans examined 2026-02-27. Album contains 42 kıt'alar on 22 panels, bound for Sultan Abdülhamit II (r. 1876–1909), Yıldız Palace binding. Scan quality (early digitization) insufficient for definitive signature reading. Specific Khandan specimen identified as fol. 2a per baysunghur.org.

entries.further_action: High-resolution scan of fol. 2a from U-M Special Collections would allow colophon reading. Contact U-M Library for folio-level catalog identifying which calligrapher is on which panel.
entries.notes: CAUTION: The 914 AH date is the earliest dated piece in the entire 42-specimen album, which contains works by multiple calligraphers. Baysunghur.org attributes the 914 AH date to this Khandan specimen specifically, but this needs independent verification — the 914 AH piece could belong to another calligrapher in the album. Album assembled in late Ottoman period from earlier specimens. Scripts include naskh, thuluth, and nastaʿlīq. Former shelfmark '210'. Abdul Hamid Collection.

text.title: Composite calligraphy leaf: rubāʿī by Omar Khayyam
text.author: Omar Khayyam (text); Sultan Muhammad Khandan (calligrapher)

manuscript.date_notes: Undated; attributed to 10th century AH based on calligraphers' activity periods.

attribution.source_citation: YJC.ir article #8827074 (September 2024), 'خیام و خواجه یحیی و امیرخسرو دهلوی در قاب زرنوشت'. Identified by Muhammad Mahdi Ahadian (Iranology Society, Hamadan branch) at exhibition in Berlin.
attribution.our_verification: Article confirmed via web search 2026-02-27. Museum is Museum für Asiatische Kunst (South Asian collection), NOT Museum für Islamische Kunst as originally reported.

entries.further_action: Contact Museum für Asiatische Kunst, Berlin for inventory number. Ahadian's identification is the primary scholarly reference. No online catalog entry found.
entries.notes: Composite leaf with three master calligraphers: (1) Muhammad Husayn Tabrizi ('Mihin Ustad') — upper section; (2) Sultan Ali Mashhadi — two lines of poetry by Khwaja Yahya; (3) Sultan Muhammad Khandan — right section, rubāʿī by Omar Khayyam. Gilded album leaf format (zarnawisht). Identified by Muhammad Mahdi Ahadian of Sharif University (amateur Iranologist, Iranology Society). The three calligraphers form a master-student chain: Sultan Ali Mashhadi taught both Muhammad Husayn Tabrizi and Khandan.

manuscript.date_notes: Colophon chronogram yields 10 Muharram 910 AH. Colophon says 'Sultan Muhammad' only — no laqab 'Khandan'. Bayani's attribution is tentative.

attribution.source_citation: Ketabpedia.com; Bayani, Mahdī. Aḥwāl va Āsār-i Khwushnivīsān. Vol. I, pp. 268, 272: scribe 'may be' (احتمالاً) Sultan Muhammad Khandan Heravi.
attribution.colophon_text: به توفیق یزدان کتابت نموده / فقیر گنه‌کار سلطان محمد
attribution.our_verification: Ketabpedia record confirmed 2026-02-27. Colophon names 'Sultan Muhammad' only; no laqab خندان. Bayani attribution is tentative.

entries.further_action: Physical inspection of colophon needed to confirm whether any additional identifying marks exist. If confirmed, this would be the earliest dated Khandan work (910 AH) and a rare Turkish-language text in his oeuvre.
entries.notes: Copied for Amir Muhammad Muʾtaman. Folios 113v–126v in composite codex. 14 lines per page. Three magnificent Timurid illuminated headpieces (سرلوح مذهب نفیس تیموری), gold headings, gold-and-lapis ruling. Attribution is TENTATIVE — colophon omits the laqab 'Khandan', giving only 'Sultan Muhammad'. Multiple calligraphers named Sultan Muhammad were active in the early 16th c.

manuscript.date_notes: Undated. Semenov (1925) describes but gives no date.

attribution.source_citation: Semenov, A.A. 'A manuscript of Sadi's Bustan by the Herat artist Sultan-Muhammad Khandan.' Izvestiya, ser. 6, vol. 19, no. 18 (1925), p. 975.
attribution.our_verification: Article not accessed online (2026-02-27). Reference from baysunghur.org article and khandan_manuscripts.md research notes.

entries.further_action: Locate Semenov 1925 article. Identify holding institution (candidates: RNL St. Petersburg, IOM RAS, National Museum of Tajikistan Dushanbe). May overlap with an existing Bustan entry if institution is identified.
entries.notes: Known only from Semenov 1925 publication. DISTINCT from bonhams_bustan_956 and chester_beatty_bustan_916 (different provenance). Could potentially be at RNL alongside stpetersburg_navai_935, or at IOM RAS, or in Dushanbe (Semenov worked extensively in Central Asia).
